global_variables.name: Organism
global_variables.description: Specify which source organism the samples have been sequenced from.

global_variables.name: Reference genome
global_variables.description: The reference genome to align the reads against. The global data repository must contain a file called <var>genome.fa</var> and the according indices at its root. Indices can be generated by the reference genome preprocessing pipeline.

steps.name: Initial QC
steps.description:
Performs an initial quality control of sequenced reads.

References

  1. Andrews S. (2010). FastQC: a quality control tool for high throughput sequence data. Available online at: Babraham Bioinformatics

variables.name: Adapter sequences
variables.description: A custom list of sequencing adapters. The global data repository must contain a file called <var>qc_adapters.txt</var> at its root.

variables.name: Kmer length
variables.description: An integer that specifies the Kmer length to be used for Kmer content detection. Must be between 2 and 10.

variables.name: SVG images
variables.description: Saves all images as vector files instead of bitmaps.

steps.name: Trimming
steps.description:
Performs trimming of adapters and low quality bases.

References

  1. Bolger, A. M., Lohse, M., & Usadel, B. (2014). Trimmomatic: A flexible trimmer for Illumina Sequence Data. Bioinformatics, btu170.

variables.name: Custom adapter sequences
variables.description: A custom list of sequencing adapters. The global data repository must contain a file called <var>trimming_adapters.fa</var> at its root. This will overwrite any of the predefined adapter sequences.

variables.name: Predefined adapter sequences
variables.description: Specify which of the predefined adapter sequences to use for trimming.

variables.name: PHRED score
variables.description: Specify which PHRED score encoding to use.

steps.name: Trimming QC
steps.description:
Performs a quality control of the trimmed reads.

References

  1. Andrews S. (2010). FastQC: a quality control tool for high throughput sequence data. Available online at: Babraham Bioinformatics

variables.name: Adapter sequences
variables.description: A custom list of sequencing adapters. The global data repository must contain a file called <var>qc_adapters.txt</var> at its root.

variables.name: Kmer length
variables.description: An integer that specifies the Kmer length to be used for Kmer content detection. Must be between 2 and 10.

variables.name: SVG images
variables.description: Saves all images as vector files instead of bitmaps.

steps.name: Alignment
steps.description:
Aligns trimmed reads against a reference genome and sorts the output.

References

  1. Langmead B, Salzberg S. Fast gapped-read alignment with Bowtie 2. Nature Methods. 2012, 9:357-359.
  2. HTSlib: C library for reading/writing high-throughput sequencing data. James K Bonfield, John Marshall, Petr Danecek, Heng Li, Valeriu Ohan, Andrew Whitwham, Thomas Keane, Robert M Davies. GigaScience, Volume 10, Issue 2, February 2021, giab007, https://doi.org/10.1093/gigascience/giab007
  3. Twelve years of SAMtools and BCFtools. GigaScience, Volume 10, Issue 2, February 2021, giab008, https://doi.org/10.1093/gigascience/giab008

steps.name: Post alignment filtering
steps.description:
Filters low quality and misaligned reads.

variables.name: Remove mitochondrial reads
variables.description: Remove all reads mapping to the mitochondiral genome.

variables.name: Removes misaligned reads
variables.description: Remove all read pairs that are not properly aligned.

variables.name: Quality filtering
variables.description: Filters all alignments with a PHRED quality score lower than the defined value.

steps.name: Splitting
steps.description:
Splits the alignment into nucleosome specific chuncks.
